{{short description|Bank}}
{{Infobox company |
  name   = Urwego Bank Plc|
  logo   = Urwego Bank logo.png|
  type   = Private|
  company_slogan = |

  location       = [[Kigali]], [[Rwanda]]|
  key_people     = Christine Baingana, [[Chief Executive Officer]]<ref>[http://www.urwegobank.com/about-us/leadership/ Leadership]</ref>|
  num_employees  = |
  assets         = 19,649,524,000 RWF ($22,352,200.03 USD) in 2018<ref>[http://www.mixmarket.org/mfi/uob Total Assets As of December 2018]</ref>|
  revenue        = |
  industry       = [[Financial services]]|
  products       = [[Loans]], individual loans, group loans, [[savings]], [[investments]]|
  homepage       = http://www.urwegobank.com
}}

'''Urwego Bank''' (Urwego) is a Christ-centered [[Microfinance|Microfinance bank]] in [[Rwanda]]. It is licensed by the [[National Bank of Rwanda]], the national banking regulator.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bnr.rw/financial-stability/bank-supervision/licensed-banks/ |title=List of Licensed Banks In Rwanda |access-date=2019-08-30 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120512113114/http://www.bnr.rw/supervision/bankregister.aspx |archive-date=2012-05-12 |url-status=dead }}</ref>

==History==
Founded in 1997 by [[World Relief]] as Urwego Community Banking, the bank joined the [[HOPE International]] network in 2005. In 2007, the bank merged with Opportunity International Bank of Rwanda to become Urwego Opportunity Bank.

With the approval of the [[National Bank of Rwanda]], [[Opportunity International]] sold its 50% ownership of Urwego to HOPE International in 2017, making HOPE a 99% shareholder in the bank, with World Relief continuing to own 1%.<ref>[https://www.urwegobank.com/about-us/ Our History]</ref>

==Overview==
Urwego Bank is a licensed, Christian faith-based [[microfinance bank]]. Drawing upon its name (Urwego is the Kinyarwanda word that translates as “ladder” in English), Urwego's mission statement is, “To provide a ladder of opportunity to underserved communities in Rwanda as we proclaim and live the Gospel of Jesus Christ.”<ref>[https://www.urwegobank.com/about-us/ About us]</ref>

Urwego seeks to reach Rwandans who are economically active but underserved by licensed banking institutions. It offers a full range of financial services, including loans and savings programs,<ref>[https://www.urwegobank.com/products/ Products]</ref> as well as training to maximize the impact of financial products and empower clients for success in business, household management, and health.

Throughout its history, Urwego Bank has distributed nearly $290 million in loans.<ref>[https://www.urwegobank.com/about-us/ About us]</ref>

==Ownership==
According to the bank's website, the following corporate entities are shareholders.
<ref>[https://www.urwegobank.com/about-us/shareholders/ Shareholders of Urwego Bank]</ref>

{| class="wikitable sortable"
! style="width:2em;" |Owner!!Percentage ownership
|-
|[[Hope International (Christian microfinance)|Hope International]]||99%
|-
|[[World Relief]]||1%
|-
|Total||100.00
|-
|}

==Branch network==
{{asof|July 2019}}, Urwego Bank had 15 full-service branches, seven of which, including the bank's headquarters, are located in the city of [[Kigali]], [[Rwanda]]'s capital.<ref>[https://www.urwegobank.com/our-locations/ Branch locations]</ref> In addition, Urwego had 15 ATM locations across the country.<ref>[https://www.urwegobank.com/our-locations/ ATM locations]</ref>

==See also==
* [[List of banks in Rwanda]]
* [[Economy of Rwanda]]

==References==
{{reflist}}

==External links==
* [https://www.urwegobank.com/ Urwego Bank website]

contentMetadata.text: Urwego Bank (Urwego) is a Christ-centered Microfinance bank in Rwanda. It is licensed by the National Bank of Rwanda, the national banking regulator. Founded in 1997 by World Relief as Urwego Community Banking, the bank joined the HOPE International network in 2005. In 2007, the bank merged with Opportunity International Bank of Rwanda to become Urwego Opportunity Bank. With the approval of the National Bank of Rwanda, Opportunity International sold its 50% ownership of Urwego to HOPE International in 2017, making HOPE a 99% shareholder in the bank, with World Relief continuing to own 1%. Urwego Bank is a licensed, Christian faith-based microfinance bank. Drawing upon its name (Urwego is the Kinyarwanda word that translates as “ladder” in English), Urwego's mission statement is, “To provide a ladder of opportunity to underserved communities in Rwanda as we proclaim and live the Gospel of Jesus Christ.” Urwego seeks to reach Rwandans who are economically active but underserved by licensed banking institutions. It offers a full range of financial services, including loans and savings programs, as well as training to maximize the impact of financial products and empower clients for success in business, household management, and health. Throughout its history, Urwego Bank has distributed nearly $290 million in loans. According to the bank's website, the following corporate entities are shareholders. As of July 2019[update], Urwego Bank had 15 full-service branches, seven of which, including the bank's headquarters, are located in the city of Kigali, Rwanda's capital. In addition, Urwego had 15 ATM locations across the country. List of banks in Rwanda Economy of Rwanda Leadership Total Assets As of December 2018 "List of Licensed Banks In Rwanda". Throughout its history, Urwego Bank has distributed nearly $290 million in loans.<ref>About us</ref>
